trans-unit.source: Identity synchronization and duplicate attribute resiliency | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Identity synchronization and duplicate attribute resiliency | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: New behavior of how to handle objects with UPN or ProxyAddress conflicts during directory sync using Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: New behavior of how to handle objects with UPN or ProxyAddress conflicts during directory sync using Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Identity synchronization and duplicate attribute resiliency
trans-unit.target: Identity synchronization and duplicate attribute resiliency

trans-unit.source: Duplicate Attribute Resiliency is a new feature being added to Azure Active Directory in order to eliminate friction caused by **UserPrincipalName** and **ProxyAddress** conflicts when running one of Microsoft’s synchronization tools.
trans-unit.target: Duplicate Attribute Resiliency is a new feature being added to Azure Active Directory in order to eliminate friction caused by **UserPrincipalName** and **ProxyAddress** conflicts when running one of Microsoft’s synchronization tools.

trans-unit.source: This feature is right now in preview.
trans-unit.target: This feature is right now in preview.

trans-unit.source: These two attributes are generally required to be unique across all **User**, **Group**, or **Contact** objects in a given Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: These two attributes are generally required to be unique across all **User**, **Group**, or **Contact** objects in a given Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Only Users can have UPNs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Only Users can have UPNs.

trans-unit.source: The new behavior that this feature enables is in the cloud portion of the sync pipeline, therefore it is client agnostic and relevant for any Microsoft synchronization product including Azure AD Connect, DirSync and MIM + Connector.
trans-unit.target: The new behavior that this feature enables is in the cloud portion of the sync pipeline, therefore it is client agnostic and relevant for any Microsoft synchronization product including Azure AD Connect, DirSync and MIM + Connector.

trans-unit.source: The generic term “sync client” will be used in this document to represent any one of these products.
trans-unit.target: The generic term “sync client” will be used in this document to represent any one of these products.

trans-unit.source: Current behavior
trans-unit.target: Current behavior

trans-unit.source: If there is an attempt to provision a new object with a UPN or ProxyAddress value that violates this uniqueness constraint, Azure Active Directory blocks that object from being created.
trans-unit.target: If there is an attempt to provision a new object with a UPN or ProxyAddress value that violates this uniqueness constraint, Azure Active Directory blocks that object from being created.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if an object is updated with a non-unique UPN or ProxyAddress, the update fails.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if an object is updated with a non-unique UPN or ProxyAddress, the update fails.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning attempt or update is retried by the sync client upon each export cycle, and will continue to fail until the conflict is resolved.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning attempt or update is retried by the sync client upon each export cycle, and will continue to fail until the conflict is resolved.

trans-unit.source: An error report email is generated upon each attempt and an error is logged by the sync client.
trans-unit.target: An error report email is generated upon each attempt and an error is logged by the sync client.

trans-unit.source: Behavior with Duplicate Attribute Resiliency
trans-unit.target: Behavior with Duplicate Attribute Resiliency

trans-unit.source: Instead of completely failing to provision or update an object with a duplicate attribute, Azure Active Directory “quarantines” the duplicate attribute which would violate the uniqueness constraint.
trans-unit.target: Instead of completely failing to provision or update an object with a duplicate attribute, Azure Active Directory “quarantines” the duplicate attribute which would violate the uniqueness constraint.

trans-unit.source: If this attribute is required for provisioning, like UserPrincipalName, the service will assign a placeholder value.
trans-unit.target: If this attribute is required for provisioning, like UserPrincipalName, the service will assign a placeholder value.

trans-unit.source: The format of these temporary values is
trans-unit.target: The format of these temporary values is

trans-unit.source: “***<OriginalPrefix>+<4DigitNumber>@<InitialTenantDomain>.onmicrosoft.com***”.
trans-unit.target: “***<OriginalPrefix>+<4DigitNumber>@<InitialTenantDomain>.onmicrosoft.com***”.

trans-unit.source: If the attribute is not required, like a **ProxyAddress**, Azure Active Directory simply quarantines the conflict attribute and proceeds with the object creation or update.
trans-unit.target: If the attribute is not required, like a **ProxyAddress**, Azure Active Directory simply quarantines the conflict attribute and proceeds with the object creation or update.

trans-unit.source: Upon quarantining the attribute, information about the conflict is sent in the same error report email used in the old behavior.
trans-unit.target: Upon quarantining the attribute, information about the conflict is sent in the same error report email used in the old behavior.

trans-unit.source: However, this info only appears in the error report one time, when the quarantine happens, it will not continue to be logged in future emails.
trans-unit.target: However, this info only appears in the error report one time, when the quarantine happens, it will not continue to be logged in future emails.

trans-unit.source: Also, since the export for this object has succeeded, the sync client does not log an error and does not retry the create / update operation upon subsequent sync cycles.
trans-unit.target: Also, since the export for this object has succeeded, the sync client does not log an error and does not retry the create / update operation upon subsequent sync cycles.

trans-unit.source: To support this behavior a new attribute has been added to the User, Group, and Contact object classes:
trans-unit.target: To support this behavior a new attribute has been added to the User, Group, and Contact object classes:

trans-unit.source: DirSyncProvisioningErrors
trans-unit.target: DirSyncProvisioningErrors

trans-unit.source: This is a multi-valued attribute that is used to store the conflicting attributes that would violate the uniqueness constraint should they be added normally.
trans-unit.target: This is a multi-valued attribute that is used to store the conflicting attributes that would violate the uniqueness constraint should they be added normally.

trans-unit.source: A background timer task has been enabled in Azure Active Directory that runs every hour to look for duplicate attribute conflicts that have been resolved, and automatically removes the attributes in question from quarantine.
trans-unit.target: A background timer task has been enabled in Azure Active Directory that runs every hour to look for duplicate attribute conflicts that have been resolved, and automatically removes the attributes in question from quarantine.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Duplicate Attribute Resiliency
trans-unit.target: Enabling Duplicate Attribute Resiliency

trans-unit.source: As mentioned earlier in this topic, this new behavior is currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned earlier in this topic, this new behavior is currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: Once it is GA, it will be enabled for all tenants automatically.
trans-unit.target: Once it is GA, it will be enabled for all tenants automatically.

trans-unit.source: While it is in preview state, it can be enabled by downloading the latest version of the Azure Active Directory PowerShell module and running:
trans-unit.target: While it is in preview state, it can be enabled by downloading the latest version of the Azure Active Directory PowerShell module and running:

trans-unit.source: During preview, UPN and ProxyAddress resiliency can be turned on and disabled individually.
trans-unit.target: During preview, UPN and ProxyAddress resiliency can be turned on and disabled individually.

trans-unit.source: Once the behavior is GA, both will be enabled for all tenants and will not be able to be disabled.
trans-unit.target: Once the behavior is GA, both will be enabled for all tenants and will not be able to be disabled.

trans-unit.source: Identifying Objects with DirSyncProvisioningErrors
trans-unit.target: Identifying Objects with DirSyncProvisioningErrors

trans-unit.source: There are currently two methods to identify objects that have these errors due to duplicate property conflicts, Azure Active Directory PowerShell and the Office 365 Admin Portal.
trans-unit.target: There are currently two methods to identify objects that have these errors due to duplicate property conflicts, Azure Active Directory PowerShell and the Office 365 Admin Portal.

trans-unit.source: There are plans to extend to additional portal based reporting in the future.
trans-unit.target: There are plans to extend to additional portal based reporting in the future.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory PowerShell

trans-unit.source: For the PowerShell cmdlets in this topic, the following is true:
trans-unit.target: For the PowerShell cmdlets in this topic, the following is true:

trans-unit.source: All of the following cmdlets are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: All of the following cmdlets are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: The **–ErrorCategory PropertyConflict** must always be included.
trans-unit.target: The **–ErrorCategory PropertyConflict** must always be included.

trans-unit.source: There are currently no other types of
trans-unit.target: There are currently no other types of

trans-unit.source: **ErrorCategory**, but this may be extended in the future.
trans-unit.target: **ErrorCategory**, but this may be extended in the future.

trans-unit.source: First, get started by running **Connect-MsolService** and entering credentials for a tenant administrator.
trans-unit.target: First, get started by running **Connect-MsolService** and entering credentials for a tenant administrator.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the following cmdlets and operators to view errors in different ways:
trans-unit.target: Then, use the following cmdlets and operators to view errors in different ways:

trans-unit.source: See All
trans-unit.target: See All

trans-unit.source: By Property Type
trans-unit.target: By Property Type

trans-unit.source: By Conflicting Value
trans-unit.target: By Conflicting Value

trans-unit.source: Using a String Search
trans-unit.target: Using a String Search

trans-unit.source: Sorted
trans-unit.target: Sorted

trans-unit.source: In a Limited Quantity or All
trans-unit.target: In a Limited Quantity or All

trans-unit.source: See all
trans-unit.target: See all

trans-unit.source: Once connected, to see a general list of attribute provisioning errors in the tenant run:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, to see a general list of attribute provisioning errors in the tenant run:

trans-unit.source: This will produce a result like the following:
trans-unit.target: This will produce a result like the following:

trans-unit.source: Get-MsolDirSyncProvisioningError
trans-unit.target: Get-MsolDirSyncProvisioningError

trans-unit.source: By property type
trans-unit.target: By property type

trans-unit.source: To see errors by property type, add the **-PropertyName** flag with the **UserPrincipalName** or **ProxyAddresses** argument:
trans-unit.target: To see errors by property type, add the **-PropertyName** flag with the **UserPrincipalName** or **ProxyAddresses** argument:

trans-unit.source: Or
trans-unit.target: Or

trans-unit.source: By conflicting value
trans-unit.target: By conflicting value

trans-unit.source: To see errors relating to a specific property add the **-PropertyValue** flag (**-PropertyName** must be used as well when adding this flag):
trans-unit.target: To see errors relating to a specific property add the **-PropertyValue** flag (**-PropertyName** must be used as well when adding this flag):

trans-unit.source: Using a string search
trans-unit.target: Using a string search

trans-unit.source: To do a broad string search use the **-SearchString** flag.
trans-unit.target: To do a broad string search use the **-SearchString** flag.

trans-unit.source: This can be used independently from all of the above flags, with the exception of **-ErrorCategory PropertyConflict**, which is always required:
trans-unit.target: This can be used independently from all of the above flags, with the exception of **-ErrorCategory PropertyConflict**, which is always required:

trans-unit.source: Sorted
trans-unit.target: Sorted

trans-unit.source: There are two flags that can be used to sort the results of a given query:
trans-unit.target: There are two flags that can be used to sort the results of a given query:

trans-unit.source: **SortField**: valid arguments include DisplayName and UserPrincipalName
trans-unit.target: **SortField**: valid arguments include DisplayName and UserPrincipalName

trans-unit.source: **SortDirection**: valid arguments include Ascending and Descending
trans-unit.target: **SortDirection**: valid arguments include Ascending and Descending

trans-unit.source: In a limited quantity or all
trans-unit.target: In a limited quantity or all

trans-unit.source: **MaxResults <Int>** can be used to limit the query to a specific number of values.
trans-unit.target: **MaxResults <Int>** can be used to limit the query to a specific number of values.

trans-unit.source: **All** can be used to ensure all results are retrieved in the case that a large number of errors exists.
trans-unit.target: **All** can be used to ensure all results are retrieved in the case that a large number of errors exists.

trans-unit.source: Office365 admin portal
trans-unit.target: Office365 admin portal

trans-unit.source: The report in the O365 portal only displays **User** objects that have these errors.
trans-unit.target: The report in the O365 portal only displays **User** objects that have these errors.

trans-unit.source: It will not show info about conflicts between **Groups**, **Contacts** or **PublicFolders**.
trans-unit.target: It will not show info about conflicts between **Groups**, **Contacts** or **PublicFolders**.

trans-unit.source: **To see these errors in the Office365 Admin Portal**:
trans-unit.target: **To see these errors in the Office365 Admin Portal**:

trans-unit.source: Log in to **portal.office.com** as a tenant administrator
trans-unit.target: Log in to **portal.office.com** as a tenant administrator

trans-unit.source: Click **Users -> Active Users**
trans-unit.target: Click **Users -> Active Users**

trans-unit.source: A warning at the top of the page will be displayed if there duplicate attribute errors on any object(s) in the tenant:
trans-unit.target: A warning at the top of the page will be displayed if there duplicate attribute errors on any object(s) in the tenant:

trans-unit.source: Active Users
trans-unit.target: Active Users

trans-unit.source: To see object specific details, choose “Users with errors” from the “Select a view” dropdown:
trans-unit.target: To see object specific details, choose “Users with errors” from the “Select a view” dropdown:

trans-unit.source: Active Users
trans-unit.target: Active Users

trans-unit.source: Click an object to see more details on the conflict, which will be displayed in the bottom right corner of the screen:
trans-unit.target: Click an object to see more details on the conflict, which will be displayed in the bottom right corner of the screen:

trans-unit.source: Active Users
trans-unit.target: Active Users

trans-unit.source: Identity synchronization error report
trans-unit.target: Identity synchronization error report

trans-unit.source: When an object with a duplicate attribute conflict is handled with this new behavior a notification is included in the standard Identity Synchronization Error Report email that is sent to the Technical Notification contact for the tenant.
trans-unit.target: When an object with a duplicate attribute conflict is handled with this new behavior a notification is included in the standard Identity Synchronization Error Report email that is sent to the Technical Notification contact for the tenant.

trans-unit.source: However, there is an important change in this behavior.
trans-unit.target: However, there is an important change in this behavior.

trans-unit.source: In the past, information about a duplicate attribute conflict would be included in every subsequent error report until the conflict was resolved.
trans-unit.target: In the past, information about a duplicate attribute conflict would be included in every subsequent error report until the conflict was resolved.

trans-unit.source: With this new behavior, the error notification for a given conflict will only appear once- at the time the conflicting attribute is quarantined.
trans-unit.target: With this new behavior, the error notification for a given conflict will only appear once- at the time the conflicting attribute is quarantined.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of what the email notification will look like for a ProxyAddress conflict:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of what the email notification will look like for a ProxyAddress conflict:

trans-unit.source: Active Users
trans-unit.target: Active Users

trans-unit.source: Resolving conflicts
trans-unit.target: Resolving conflicts

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting strategy and resolution tactics for these errors should not differ from the way duplicate attribute errors were handled in the past.
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting strategy and resolution tactics for these errors should not differ from the way duplicate attribute errors were handled in the past.

trans-unit.source: The only difference is that the timer task will sweep through the tenant on the service-side to automatically add the attribute in question to the proper object once the conflict is resolved.
trans-unit.target: The only difference is that the timer task will sweep through the tenant on the service-side to automatically add the attribute in question to the proper object once the conflict is resolved.

trans-unit.source: The following article outlines various troubleshooting and resolution strategies: [Duplicate or invalid attributes prevent directory synchronization in Office 365](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2647098).
trans-unit.target: The following article outlines various troubleshooting and resolution strategies: [Duplicate or invalid attributes prevent directory synchronization in Office 365](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2647098).

trans-unit.source: Known issues
trans-unit.target: Known issues

trans-unit.source: None of these known issues will cause data loss or service degradation.
trans-unit.target: None of these known issues will cause data loss or service degradation.

trans-unit.source: Several of them are aesthetic, others cause standard “*pre-resiliency*” duplicate attribute errors to be thrown instead of quarantining the conflict attribute, and another causes certain errors to require extra manual fix-up.
trans-unit.target: Several of them are aesthetic, others cause standard “*pre-resiliency*” duplicate attribute errors to be thrown instead of quarantining the conflict attribute, and another causes certain errors to require extra manual fix-up.

trans-unit.source: Core behavior:
trans-unit.target: Core behavior:

trans-unit.source: User with specific attribute configuration continues receiving export errors as opposed to attributes being quarantined.
trans-unit.target: User with specific attribute configuration continues receiving export errors as opposed to attributes being quarantined.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: New user with is created in AD with a UPN of **Joe@contoso.com** and ProxyAddress **smtp:Joe@contoso.com**
trans-unit.target: New user with is created in AD with a UPN of **Joe@contoso.com** and ProxyAddress **smtp:Joe@contoso.com**

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: The properties of this object conflict with an existing Group, where ProxyAddress is **SMTP:Joe@contoso.com**.
trans-unit.target: The properties of this object conflict with an existing Group, where ProxyAddress is **SMTP:Joe@contoso.com**.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Upon export, a **ProxyAddress conflict** error is thrown instead of having the conflict attributes quarantined.
trans-unit.target: Upon export, a **ProxyAddress conflict** error is thrown instead of having the conflict attributes quarantined.

trans-unit.source: The operation is retried upon each subsequent sync cycle, as it would have been before the resiliency feature was enabled.
trans-unit.target: The operation is retried upon each subsequent sync cycle, as it would have been before the resiliency feature was enabled.

trans-unit.source: The timer task that looks for resolved duplicate attribute conflicts only compares UPN conflicts with other UPN conflicts.
trans-unit.target: The timer task that looks for resolved duplicate attribute conflicts only compares UPN conflicts with other UPN conflicts.

trans-unit.source: This causes the problem shown in step 4 of the following scenario:
trans-unit.target: This causes the problem shown in step 4 of the following scenario:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: **UserA@contoso.com** has a non-unique UPN due to another object's ProxyAddress also having that value.
trans-unit.target: **UserA@contoso.com** has a non-unique UPN due to another object's ProxyAddress also having that value.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: UserA is given a temporary **MOERA UPN**, **UserA1234@contoso.onmicrosoft.com** and the real UPN value is quarantined (as expected).
trans-unit.target: UserA is given a temporary **MOERA UPN**, **UserA1234@contoso.onmicrosoft.com** and the real UPN value is quarantined (as expected).

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: The other conflicting object has the ProxyAddress removed later.
trans-unit.target: The other conflicting object has the ProxyAddress removed later.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: UserA's UPN is never fixed automatically; it must be updated manually.
trans-unit.target: UserA's UPN is never fixed automatically; it must be updated manually.

trans-unit.source: If two Groups are created on-premises with the same SMTP address, one will fail to provision on the first attempt with a standard duplicate **ProxyAddress** error.
trans-unit.target: If two Groups are created on-premises with the same SMTP address, one will fail to provision on the first attempt with a standard duplicate **ProxyAddress** error.

trans-unit.source: However, the duplicate value will be properly quarantined upon the next sync cycle.
trans-unit.target: However, the duplicate value will be properly quarantined upon the next sync cycle.

trans-unit.source: **PowerShell cmdlets**:
trans-unit.target: **PowerShell cmdlets**:

trans-unit.source: **ImmutableId** / **LastDirSyncTime** are not displayed for the User object class.
trans-unit.target: **ImmutableId** / **LastDirSyncTime** are not displayed for the User object class.

trans-unit.source: **SortField** and **SortDirection** flags do not affect results.
trans-unit.target: **SortField** and **SortDirection** flags do not affect results.

trans-unit.source: Using the **PropertyValue** flag without adding the **PropertyName** flag throws an ambiguous error.
trans-unit.target: Using the **PropertyValue** flag without adding the **PropertyName** flag throws an ambiguous error.

trans-unit.source: **SearchString** flag returns extra results if run without the **PropertyValue** and **PropertyName** flags.
trans-unit.target: **SearchString** flag returns extra results if run without the **PropertyValue** and **PropertyName** flags.

trans-unit.source: **Office Portal Report**:
trans-unit.target: **Office Portal Report**:

trans-unit.source: The detailed error message for two objects in a UPN conflict set is the same.
trans-unit.target: The detailed error message for two objects in a UPN conflict set is the same.

trans-unit.source: This indicates that they have both had their UPN changed / quarantined, when in fact only a one of them had any data changed.
trans-unit.target: This indicates that they have both had their UPN changed / quarantined, when in fact only a one of them had any data changed.

trans-unit.source: The detailed error message for a UPN conflict shows the wrong displayName for a user who has had their UPN changed/quarantined.
trans-unit.target: The detailed error message for a UPN conflict shows the wrong displayName for a user who has had their UPN changed/quarantined.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: **User A** syncs up first with **UPN = User@contoso.com**.
trans-unit.target: **User A** syncs up first with **UPN = User@contoso.com**.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: **User B** is attempted to be synced up next with **UPN = User@contoso.com**.
trans-unit.target: **User B** is attempted to be synced up next with **UPN = User@contoso.com**.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: **User B’s** UPN is changed to **User1234@contoso.onmicrosoft.com** and **User@contoso.com** is added to **DirSyncProvisioningErrors**.
trans-unit.target: **User B’s** UPN is changed to **User1234@contoso.onmicrosoft.com** and **User@contoso.com** is added to **DirSyncProvisioningErrors**.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: The error message for **User B** should indicate that **User A** already has **User@contoso.com** as a UPN, but it shows **User B’s** own displayName.
trans-unit.target: The error message for **User B** should indicate that **User A** already has **User@contoso.com** as a UPN, but it shows **User B’s** own displayName.

trans-unit.source: The report may only display detailed error information for users with **UPN** conflicts, not for those with **ProxyAddress** errors (still investigating whether this is consistent or environmental).
trans-unit.target: The report may only display detailed error information for users with **UPN** conflicts, not for those with **ProxyAddress** errors (still investigating whether this is consistent or environmental).

trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync
